name: Dark Peak Christmas offer: £6.50+FREE P&P (UK only)
description:
CHRISTMAS SPECIAL OFFER

Dark Peak: The First Elemental 
FICTION: NOVEL
ISBN: 978-0-9569122-2-0
Price: £8.99 (Paperback – RRP)
Extent: 332pp
SPECIAL OFFER ONLY: FREE UK P&P

Dark Peak. A land of long fields and rough mountains; a battleground where two of the Earth’s protectors meet the worst of humanity’s excesses made flesh. And one of them, Jake Walker, doesn’t even know what he’s doing. Not really. He’s only had a few weeks to get used to the idea. And it’s not long enough. Luckily, the other, Stone, has had millennia to get used to it. And that is long enough. But it’ll take more than time to beat this enemy, and nothing, nothing, is guaranteed.

Open up to 18th DECEMBER 2013

name: Dark Peak – Signed Limited Edition
description:
Dark Peak: The First Elemental

Signed Limited Edition Hardback with Artwork.

T﻿his Limited Edition hardback is beautifully produced with a hand-printed linocut of the Limestone Map, a central feature of the novel’s narrative. The book’s binding is hand-finished with a high gloss dust jacket and hand-made paper wrap sealed with the insignia of the Limestone Elemental. With only 25 copies produced, this is a very limited edition. 

UK – Specail Delivery
ROW – Airmail/Signed

name: Earthworks by Jacqueline Gabbitas
description:
‘This wonderful sequence of poems cuts into the earth beneath the thin layer of soil to articulate a voice that knots life to death. Gabbitas’s language is vital, visceral, having its effect directly in our body. The poetics of direct speech and the richness of vocabulary brings the reader in contact with the raw reality of life. This is profoundly moving poetry that repays re-reading and bearing close to the heart.’ – Sharon Morris

ISBN: 978-0-9569122-3-7
Publisher: Stonewood Press 
Price: £4.99 (Pocket book) 
Extent: 32 pages
Publication: September 2012

name: John Rety – Notebook in hand: New and Sected Poems
description:
With a foreword by Stephen Watts and an afterword by Emily Johns.

John Rety - writer, editor and publisher, chess player, anarchist and pacifist - was best known in the literary world for his contributions to poetry, especially the much loved Torriano Meeting House events and Hearing Eye press. Less well known is John's own poetry. Notebook in Hand is a selection from his collections as well as unpublished and new poems. His poetry is both simple and complex - tender, funny, poignant, and companionable, it is also edgy, acerbic, troubled and disappointed. As well as his better-known comic poetry, Notebook in Hand presents tender lyrics and trenchant political meditations, some of which may surprise, but will certainly delight, his readers.

﻿ISBN: 978-0-9569122-1-3 
Publisher: Stonewood Press 
Price: £10.95 (Paperback)
Extent: 128 pages
Publication: February 2012
